chargeHist.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage
Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Mohamed F Zormati was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution hearing scheduled December 13, 2022 at 10:30 AM.  lf extended supervision is revoked and the defendant will have a mandatory release from prison, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
lf extended supervision is revoked and the defendant will have a mandatory release from prison, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment or full time school status, or a combination of employment and school equal to full time status.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent. 

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. 

Defendant shall obtain and maintain a stable residence. 

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription. 

Defendant shall not enter any establishments whose primary purpose is the sale or serving of alcohol.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes:
lf probation will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due. lf the defendant's probation is revoked with outstanding financial obligations and a jail sentence is ordered at the sentencing after revocation, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.  

If restitution imposed in count two (2) is not paid in full during extended supervision imposed in count two (2) then it shall be paid as a condition of probation in count four (4).
All conditions and prohibitions imposed in count two (2) shall continue as conditions/prohibitions of probation in count four (4).

Colloquy regarding PSI, State indicates there are no errors except there appears to be an omission as to the request for restitution; Attorney Weil has reviewed the PSI with the defendant and indicates there are no corrections to be made to the PSI; Court questions defendant regarding PSI and defendant states there are no corrections needed. On a plea to Ct 2 and 4, State moves to dismiss and read in Ct's 1, 3, and 5 and agrees to cap its recommendation at 5 years of initial confinement and will be requesting PSI; No contest plea entered as to Ct 2 and Ct 4; Court finds def guilty on Ct. 2 and 4, on motion of the State Ct's 1, 3, and 5 are dismissed for read in and Court orders a PSI be completed.  State requests bond be revoked; Court revokes bond and remands defendant into custody.
